flash.tools.debugger.concrete

Class DManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • flash.tools.debugger.concrete.DManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DProtocolNotifierIF, SourceLocator

    public class DManager
extends Object
implements DProtocolNotifierIF, SourceLocator
    Implements the receiving and updating of debug state from the socket connection of the Flash Player.

      • getPreviousValue

        public DValue getPreviousValue(long id,
                      int isolateId)
        Returns the previous value object for the given id -- that is, the value that that object had the last time the player was suspended. Never requests it from the player (because it can't, of course). Returns null if we don't have a value for that id.

        public boolean isGetSupported()

        public int getEventCount()
        Event management related stuff

      • getEventNotifier

        public Object getEventNotifier()
        Get an object on which callers can call wait(), in order to wait until something happens. Note: The object will be signalled when EITHER of the following happens: (1) An event is added to the event queue; (2) The network connection is broken (and thus there will be no more events).
        Returns:
        an object on which the caller can call wait()

        public void disconnected()
        Issued when the socket connection to the player is cut
        Specified by:
        disconnected in interface DProtocolNotifierIF

      • messageArrived

        public void messageArrived(DMessage msg,
                  DProtocol which)
        This is the core routine for decoding incoming messages and deciding what should be done with them. We have registered ourself with DProtocol to be notified when any incoming messages have been received. It is important to note that we should not rely on the contents of the message since it may be reused after we exit this method.
        Specified by:
        messageArrived in interface DProtocolNotifierIF

      • convertToURI

        public static String convertToURI(String playerURL)
        The player sends us a URI using '|' instead of ':'

      • beginPlayerCodeExecution

        public void beginPlayerCodeExecution(int isolateId)
        Tell us that we are about to start executing user code in the player, such as a getter, a setter, or a function call. If a FaultEvent comes in while the code is executing, it is not added to the event queue in the normal way -- instead, it is saved, and is returned when endPlayerCodeExecution() is called.

      • endPlayerCodeExecution

        public FaultEvent endPlayerCodeExecution(int isolateId)
        Informs us that user code is no longer executing, and returns the fault, if any, which occurred while the code was executing.

      • locateSource

        public InputStream locateSource(String path,
                       String pkg,
                       String name)
        Description copied from interface: SourceLocator
        Callback from DJAPI to the debugger, to find a source file. Returns null if it can't find the file.
        Specified by:
        locateSource in interface SourceLocator

      • getChangeCount

        public int getChangeCount()
        Description copied from interface: SourceLocator
        Returns a number which indicates how many times this SourceLocator's search algorithm has been changed since it was created. For example, if a SourceLocator allows the user to change the list of directories that are searched, then each time the user changes that list of directories, the return value from getChangeCount() should change. The DJAPI uses this in order to figure out if it should try again to look for a source file that it had previously been unable to find.
        Specified by:
        getChangeCount in interface SourceLocator

      • getOption

        public String getOption(String optionName)
        Returns the value of a Flash Player option that was requested by OutGetOption and returned by InOption.
        Parameters:
        optionName - the name of the option
        Returns:
        its value, or null
